incidents.name: Failures To Access API GET List For Account AvailablePhoneNumber TollFree

incident_updates.body: All services impacted by an issue with Twilio Rest API have recovered and are operating as intended. This incident has been resolved.

We are experiencing failures to access GET API List for Account, AvailablePhoneNumber and TollFree is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

1. inventory-search-service (the service used to look up the numbers in Elastic Search) is returning some numbers that are not present inventory_dids_to_did_tags table. This seems to be related to an onboarding issue with a subset of tollfree numbers.
This is causing as to use our fallback and go to the database. This is happening for most tollfree requests to the available phone numbers page.
2. When the pageSize is set in the request, the query issued to the database is faster than when the pageSize is not included. That's why the issue only shows up for the requests without a pageSize.

We expect to provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue with the AvailablePhoneNumbers/TollFree api returning 500 errors and are working to deploy a fix. As a workaround please include a PageSize parameter in your requests at this time. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing failures to access GET API List for Account, AvailablePhoneNumber and TollFree. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing failures to access GET API List for Account, AvailablePhoneNumber and TollFree. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with access GET API List for Account, AvailablePhoneNumber and TollFree. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Studio Messaging Scheduler Service 500 Errors

incident_updates.body: Twilio messaging-scheduler-service and messaging-scheduler-service-mms was degraded for 11 minutes between 3:14 pm and 3:25 pm Pacific Time on 09/12/2023. During this period of time customers may have experienced a high rate of 5xx failures, affecting the Studio and MMS products, respectively. The issue has now been resolved.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Studio 500 errors. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: US Toll-Free Numbers Not Available For Purchase

Purchase of US Toll-Free Numbers within Console and AP is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Calls to China phone numbers are still facing some rejections, we are working close with our carrier partners in China in order to obtain more information about this performance, and we will continue monitoring stability of the route. We will provide another update on September 11 at 14:00 PDT Time, or a soon as more information becomes available

Calls to China phone numbers are starting to recover. We will continue to monitor for system stability on an extended basis. We’ll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the issue with number porting and it was determined that there is no noticeable customer impact. All systems are operational.
We've become aware of potential delays with number porting. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Super SIM Connectivity Issues Detected

incident_updates.body: Super SIM Connectivity Issue has been resolved and [product][service] is operating normally at this time.
Our engineers are still monitoring the network connectivity. We’ll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are now seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Since ~14:25 AM UTC we observed ~30% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. At this moment, devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances and backup networks. Currently, we are still monitoring the situation as approximately 12% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. These devices might encounter poor data connection or have short-lived sessions. Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner as soon as we have more information available.

Since ~14:25 AM UTC we observed ~30% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Currently, we are still monitoring the situation as approximately 12% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. These devices might encounter poor data connection or have short-lived sessions. Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner as soon as we have more information available.

Since ~14:25 AM UTC we observed ~30% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. At this moment, devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances and backup networks. Currently, we are still monitoring the situation as approximately 15% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. These devices might encounter poor data connection or have short-lived sessions. Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner as soon as we have more information available.
We detected that some of the customers can experience connectivity issues. Our team is investigating the outage. We will provide an update in 1 hour from now, or sooner if more info is available.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Surf Telecom and American Net in Brazil From Registered Sender IDs and Short Codes

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Surf Telecom in Brazil from registered sender IDs and Short Codes. This incident has been resolved.

Our engineers are still monitoring SMS delivery to Surf Telecom and American Net in Brazil from registered sender IDs and Short Codes. We’ll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

SMS delivery to Surf Telecom in Brazil from registered sender IDs and Short Codes are starting to recover.  American Net is not showing improvement. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We’ll provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Surf Telecom and American Net in Brazil from registered sender IDs and Short Codes. incidents.name: SMS Delivery Failure to Altan Redes Network in Mexico

incident_updates.body: The incident causing SMS delivery failures to to Altan Redes Network in Mexico using short codes and registered Alpha Sender IDs has been resolved, except for a small number of customers. We are closing this incident and will reach out to these customers individually for further follow-ups.

SMS messages sent from short codes to Altan Redes Network in Mexico are successfully being delivered and the sender is not being replaced, allowing replies to be received. Additionally we continue to see recovery in SMS messages sent from registered Alpha Sender IDs to Altan Redes Network in Mexico. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

SMS messages sent from short codes to Altan Redes Network in Mexico are successfully being delivered but with a generic Alpha Sender ID, so 2-way is currently not possible. Additionally customers who have registered an Alpha Sender ID in Mexico were experiencing 100% failure towards the specific network but we are now seeing a recovery. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing successful SMS delivery to Altan Redes Network in Mexico using subset of Short Codes. We will continue to monitor to ensure full service recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to investigate SMS delivery failure when sending messages to Altan Redes Network in Mexico using subset of Short Codes. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to investigate SMS delivery failure when sending messages to Altan Redes Network in Mexico using subset of Short Codes. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing SMS delivery failure when sending messages to Altan Redes Network in Mexico using subset of Shortcodes. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unauthorized Sessions Will Encounter an Endless Spinner

incident_updates.body: Issue causing unauthorized sessions getting to an endless spinner has been resolved and Twilio's console is operating normally at this time.
Twilio's console is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue causing unauthorized sessions to get to an endless spinner and are working to deploy a fix. Current workaround is to manually navigate to www.twilio.com and then log in. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are seeing an issue with the Twilio's console where unauthorized sessions cause an endless spinner. Our engineering team is looking into the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Twilio's console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
